original: EVERITT, Carl Birger, överingenjör, Ör- viken, f Norra Råda, Värml, 9/3 93 av civ.irig C F Pettersson o Maria Söderberg, gm Svea Andersson. Studex v Södermalms h a l 11, KTH 11—14. Elev o undering v öhrvikens AB örviken 14—20, ing o driftsled v fi sulfit- o sulfatfabr i USA 20—33, ing v öhrvikens AB 33, övering sed. 35. Led komm.nmd, skolstyr, luftskydd. Styr.led i Vbott Tekn frn. Resor: USA, Canada 20—33, Frankr 35, Holl 37, Engl 39. Led av F & A M, W 6, Rotary. Hobbies: Idrott, musik.
translated: EVERITT, Carl Birger, Chief Engineer, Ör- viken, born in Norra Råda, Värmland, on March 9th, 1893. Son of civil engineer C.F. Pettersson and Maria Söderberg, married to Svea Andersson. Graduated from Södermalms högre allmänna läroverk in 1911, and from the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) in 1911-1914. Apprentice and assistant engineer at öhrvikens AB in Örviken from 1914-1920. Engineer and plant manager at a sulfite and sulfate factory in the US from 1920-1933, then engineer at öhrvikens AB in 1933, and promoted to Chief Engineer in 1935. Member of the municipal committee, school board, and air protection committee. Board member of Värmlands Tekniska Förening. Traveled to the US and Canada from 1920-1933, France in 1935, the Netherlands in 1937, and England in 1939. Member of the Free Masons (F & A M), Lodge W 6, and Rotary. Hobbies: Sports, music.
